ArticleTitle.sentence: SLP-76 and Vav function in separate, but overlapping pathways to augment interleukin-2 promoter activity.

event.clue: SLP-76 and Vav function in separate, but overlapping pathways to augment interleukin-2 promoter activity.

AbstractText.sentence: SLP-76 and Vav, two hematopoietic cell specific molecules, are critical for T cell development and activation.

AbstractText.sentence: Following T cell antigen receptor stimulation, SLP-76 and Vav both undergo tyrosine phosphorylation and associate with each other via the SH2 domain of Vav and phosphorylated tyrosines of SLP-76.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, SLP-76 and Vav have a synergistic effect on interleukin (IL)-2 promoter activity in T cells.

event.clue: Furthermore, SLP-76 and Vav have a synergistic effect on interleukin (IL)-2 promoter activity in T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: In this report, we show that two tyrosines, Tyr-113 and Tyr-128, of SLP-76 are required for its binding to Vav, both in vitro and in intact cells.

event.clue: In this report, we show that two tyrosines, Tyr-113 and Tyr-128, of SLP-76 are required for its binding to Vav, both in vitro and in intact cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Surprisingly, we find also that the interaction between SLP-76 and Vav is not required for their cooperation in augmenting IL-2 promoter activity, as the two molecules appear to function in different signaling pathways upstream of IL-2 gene expression.

AbstractText.sentence: Overexpression of SLP-76 in the Jurkat T cell line potentiates the activities of both nuclear factor of activated T cells and AP-1 transcription factors.
